_header: Honoured be Thou blissful Lord benign
Title(s): Song of the Nativity of the Virgin Mary; Pèlerinage de l’âme
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, Song of the Nativity of the Virgin Mary, in the English translation of the Pèlerinage de l’âme — seven stanzas rhyme royal

Bod770.First Lines:
HOnourid be þou blissid lord benygneþan vnto man now wilt
                    be merciable…
Bod770.Last Lines:
…ffor loue of here honour we þis dayeWith all our songe
                    all that we maye
Bod770.Attributed Title:
Of þe song of þe natiuite of our lady (f. 91ra); Here
                    endeþ þe song (f. 91rb)

OxfCCC237.First Lines:
Honowred be þowe blestfull lorde benyngneÞat vn to man
                    wolte nowe be merciable…
OxfCCC237.Last Lines:
…ffor love of her honowr we þis dayWith all þe songe
                    & þat we maye

CamGon124.First Lines:
honoured be þu blisful lord benygneþat now vn to man wolt
                    be mercyable…
CamGon124.Last Lines:
…ffor loue of hire honoure we þis dayWiþ alle
                    þe songes & myrþes þat we may

CULKk17.First Lines:
Honourid be þou blisful lord benygneThat now vn to man wilt be
                    mercyable…
CULKk17.Last Lines:
…ffor loueof hir honoure we þis dayWith alle þe
                    songis and merthis þat we may
CULKk17.Attributed Title:
her endith þe drem of þe pilgrimage of þe soule (f.
                        124v)

BLAdd34193.First Lines:
Honourede be þou lorde benigneþat to mane will nowe be
                    merciable…
BLAdd34193.Last Lines:
…ffor lufe of her honoure to dayewithe all þe songe
                    þat we maye

BLEge615.First Lines: HOnured be thu blisseful lord benigneThat now vnto man wil be merciable…
BLEge615.Last Lines: …ffor loue of hire honure we this dayWith alle the songes & myrthes þat we may
BLEge615.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             “Hoccleve’s Works: The Regement of Princes and fourteen minor
                poems.” 
             EETS
         e.s. 72 (1897); repr. 1988: xlv-xlvii.

NYPLSpenc19.First Lines:
Honoured be thow blisful lord benigneThat now vn to men wilt be
                    merciable…
NYPLSpenc19.Last Lines:
…ffor loue of hir honoure we this dayWith alle songes and
                    myrthes þat we may
NYPLSpenc19.Attributed Title:
The recordyng of aungeles song of the natiuite of oure lady (f.
                    122)
